keyTakeAways: Reefline is a 7-mile-long artificial reef project off Miami Beach designed to restore a lost coral habitat and create an underwater ecotourism attraction.
The project combines art and science, featuring marine-grade concrete sculptures — such as cars and starfish — that will support coral growth over time.
Colin Foord, a coral scientist and founder of Coral Morphologic, is responsible for cultivating and transplanting resilient soft corals to the reef.
Ximena Caminos, an arts curator from Argentina, is the project's artistic director and cultural placemaker, overseeing the integration of art and ecological restoration.
The project is funded in part by a $5 million Miami Beach bond approved by voters and aims to raise an additional $6 million to begin the first phase.
The reef will be accessible to the public at only 15–20 feet deep, requiring only a mask and fins, without needing a boat.
Reefline aims to restore a natural habitat that was lost in the 1970s due to sand replenishment of the beach.
The project includes an onshore marine learning center to educate the public on coral reef conservation.
The final phase may feature 57 giant starfish sculptures, potentially becoming a symbolic landmark for Miami Beach.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Miami Beach is launching the Reefline project, a 7-mile-long artificial reef extending from the shoreline, combining art and science to restore a lost coral habitat. Led by artist and cultural placemaker Ximena Caminos and coral scientist Colin Foord, the project involves casting underwater sculptures — including cars and starfish — from marine-grade concrete. These sculptures serve as substrates for resilient soft corals like gorgonians, which are cultivated in nurseries and transplanted onto the reef. The reef, planned to take at least a decade to complete, will be accessible to the public at only 15 to 20 feet deep, 700 feet off the beach. Funded by a $5 million city bond and aiming to raise an additional $6 million, the project seeks to revive Miami Beach’s historical coral reef, promote ecotourism, and educate the public on coral reef conservation through an onshore learning center. Ultimately, Reefline blends environmental restoration with artistic innovation, aiming to become a symbol of sustainable urban coastal development and marine life recovery.
title: Miami Beach puts the art in offshore artificial reef
